    • Method Detail

      • ReadFile

        public static java.lang.String[][] ReadFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a CSV (Comma-separated values) file and converts it to a table. Every line in the file represents a single row. The columns are separated by a character and quotes are marked with the character.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String Path of the file to be read
        Returns:
        The CSV table as two-dimensional string array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws exception if the document could not be read or does not has the expected format
        See Also:
        Common Format and MIME Type for Comma-Separated Values (CSV) Files, FileUtils.ReadPlainFile(String)

      • WriteFile

        public static void WriteFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                             java.lang.String[][] content)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an string array to a file in the CSV format. If the file does not exist jet, it is created. If the given content is null, nothing is written and no file is created.

        Vales are separated by DEFAULT_SEPARATOR DEFAULT_QUOTE is usesd as quoting character.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The path of the file to be written
        content - The content which is written to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if file could not be written
